deal as weakening Italy's system of national contracts, but other unions backed it as encouraging investment. The bitter campaign split Italy's powerful labor unions. Industry Minister Maurizio Sacconi hailed the victory. The outcome of the referendum opens an evolution in industrial relations, especially in large factories that should allow a better use of the plants and a real increase in salaries, Maurizio Sacconi told Italian state radio. Sergio Marchionne had pledged to link pay increases to productivity. But the flexible work rules also limit the right to strike during full production, and reduce break times and sick pay
